title: Fixing Astropy

content.raw: I can't tell for sure, but it looks like you can never get down to this check.
content.html: I can't tell for sure, but it looks like you can never get down to this check.

content.raw: How come?  I think if `ext.upper() in ("FITS", "FTS")` is true, you can.
content.html: How come? I think if ext.upper() in ("FITS", "FTS") is true, you can.

content.raw: The check for `HDUList` is for when an in-memory FITS file is passed in, so I think that an exception will be raised on the first try block, which means that it will automatically return `False`.
content.html: The check for HDUList is for when an in-memory FITS file is passed in, so I think that an exception will be raised on the first try block, which means that it will automatically return False.

content.raw: Hmmm.  Okay.  Well, what if I checked the string of the class name?
content.html: Hmmm. Okay. Well, what if I checked the string of the class name?

content.raw: The original behavior was for each of the try blocks to pass if there was an exception raised. If all of them passed, then it would end up returning `False`. Can we not revert back to that behavior? But I suppose your solution is cleaner...
content.html: The original behavior was for each of the try blocks to pass if there was an exception raised. If all of them passed, then it would end up returning False. Can we not revert back to that behavior? But I suppose your solution is cleaner...

content.raw: No, because that mandates importing astropy every time we call `load()` anywhere.
content.html: No, because that mandates importing astropy every time we call load() anywhere.

content.raw: Ok, then we go with your idea then.
content.html: Ok, then we go with your idea then.

content.raw: Something went wrong, you should checkout http://tests.yt-project.org/job/py2.7-yt-3.0_testing/294/
Something went wrong, you should checkout http://tests.yt-project.org/job/py2.7-yt-3.0_testing/297/
Something went wrong, you should checkout http://tests.yt-project.org/job/py2.7-yt-3.0_testing/299/
I think we can use astropy's `if log.exception_logging_enabled():` since we don't know what `log.disable_exception_logging()` may throw at us.
content.html: I think we can use astropy's if log.exception_logging_enabled(): since we don't know what log.disable_exception_logging() may throw at us.

content.raw: Parallel stuff now works as expected for me. Both from yt.mods import * and import yt; yt.enable_parallelism() result in the right setup.  I think the way it is done seems okay.
content.html: Parallel stuff now works as expected for me. Both from yt.mods import * and import yt; yt.enable_parallelism() result in the right setup. I think the way it is done seems okay.

content.raw: @jzuhone wasn't sure if this was going to get called, but he's not able to take a look for a while.  We can either accept and update if it needs it, or wait.
content.html: John ZuHone wasn't sure if this was going to get called, but he's not able to take a look for a while. We can either accept and update if it needs it, or wait.

content.raw: Something went wrong, you should checkout http://tests.yt-project.org/job/py2.7-yt-3.0_testing/309/
I'll be able to look at it in about 4 hours or so.
content.html: I'll be able to look at it in about 4 hours or so.

content.raw: Something went wrong, you should checkout http://tests.yt-project.org/job/py2.7-yt-3.0_testing/315/
Something went wrong, you should checkout http://tests.yt-project.org/job/py2.7-yt-3.0_testing/316/
In the interest of having running tests I've accepted this.  @jzuhone if your testing finds issues with the fits frontend can you open a new PR?
content.html: In the interest of having running tests I've accepted this. John ZuHone if your testing finds issues with the fits frontend can you open a new PR?

description:
This creates a very demand importer and also doesn't allow non-fits suffices in `_is_valid`.

UPDATE 1: @jzuhone does this look better to you?

UPDATE 2: Another pass.

UPDATE 3: @jzuhone suggested removing `_is_valid` for now.

UPDATE 4: This includes @xarthisius 's changes as well as fixing up some parallelism things.  I have tested them here, but it would be good to get a set of eyes from @samskillman .  I have changed slightly where communicators get created; now an empty one is always created, and when parallelism is turned on, we can push another on top.

UPDATE 5: Now we actually do turn off log.
